item.title: Running CoreDNS on Ubuntu 18.04
item.description: Systemd runs a local DNS stub resolver on 127.0.0.53:53. It acts as a proxy and forwards all DNS queries to Google or Cloudflare DNS servers (1.1.1.1, 8.8.8.8, 1.0.0.1, 8.8.4.4) by default. All local DNS queries get resolved through it default resolver configuration in /etc/resolv.conf points to it (nameserver 127.0.0.53). This file is actually a symbolic link to /var/run/systemd/resolve/stub-resolv.conf which is a dynamic resolver (routines in C library) configuration managed by systemd-resolved
